name: MetroSelect

props.name: size
props.description: Visual size of the tiles; token or explicit CSS size.

props.name: name
props.description:
Field identifier used for FormControl binding and forwarded to the underlying control
when applicable. Components can require `name` locally if they depend on it.

props.name: label
props.description: Visual label rendered by the component or its wrapper. Accepts string or node.

props.name: helperText
props.description: Supplemental hint or validation content typically rendered under the control.

props.name: error
props.description: Marks the field invalid; components may adjust visuals and helper text color.

props.name: fullWidth
props.description: Stretches the field wrapper to occupy the full available width.

props.name: preset
props.description: One or many style-preset names registered via `definePreset()`

bestPractices: Use for compact choice sets where visual labels and icons help recognition.
Choose `multiple` when users should select more than one; otherwise keep singleâ€‘select.
Keep options short and distinct; avoid long labels that wrap unpredictably.
Expose clear values via `value` so form binding and analytics stay consistent.
Control spacing with `gap` using theme spacing tokens or numbers to match density.
Keyboard: ensure arrow keys move focus predictably and Space toggles selection.

examples.title: Uncontrolled
examples.code:
<MetroSelect defaultValue='home' gap={4}>
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:home' value='home' label='Home' />
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:briefcase' value='work' label='Work' disabled />
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:airplane' value='travel' label='Travel' />
</MetroSelect>

examples.title: Controlled value
Multiple selection
examples.code:
<MetroSelect multiple defaultValue={['home','travel']} gap={4}>
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:home' value='home' label='Home' />
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:airplane' value='travel' label='Travel' />
  <MetroSelect.Option icon='mdi:briefcase' value='work' label='Work' disabled />
</MetroSelect>
